Old woman and her grandson from Glasgow lodge at Hare’s home; Burke andHare smother them and sell their bodies to Dr. Knox for ₤8 each.
Burke and Nelly move two streets away, in to an apartment with Burke’s cousinand her husband, the Broggans.
Margaret Haldane, daughter of Mary Haldane, suffocated at the Broggan’s byBurke; body sold to Dr. Knox for ₤8.
Mrs Ostler, a washer, comes to the Broggan’s. Burke and Hare get her drunk, thensuffocate her. Body sold to Dr. Knox for ₤8.
Ann McDougal comes to visit Nelly at the Broggan’s; Hare and Burke get herdrunk, then kill her. Body sold to Dr. Knox for ₤10.

Jamie Wilson, who is mentally retarded, is invited to Hare’s home by Hare’sgirlfriend, Maggie Laird; Wilson drinks some, and Burke and Hare suffocate him.They strip his body, taking a spoon and snuff box. Body sold to Dr. Knox for ₤10.
Mrs. Docherty lured back to Burke’s; killed after the Halloween party by Burkeand Hare. The struggle is heard by many of Burke’s neighbors.
James Gray, neighbor of Burke, goes to the police after his wife discovers thecorpse of Mrs. Docherty. Nelly and Burke are taken in for questioning.
Police discover the corpse of Mrs. Docherty in Dr. Knox’s basement. The bodywas identified by neighbors of Burke; Burke, Hare, Nelly and Maggie are chargedwith murder.
Hare and his wife Maggie offered immunity if Hare comes forward about Mrs.Docherty and any other of Burke’s murders. Burke was set for trial on two countsof murder.
Burke found guilty on majority vote (two members voted not guilty) and Nelly isfound not guilty. Burke sentenced to hanging on January 28, 1829, and his bodyto then be dissected.
Burke is hanged publicly. His body is then dissected publicly, in accordance witha law from 1752.
